reviewText: I first heard of this show from a family friend my parents knew, who would drop anything to watch the show on TV.  So my mom and I teamed up and watched season one (more like an introduction), and this became the kind of show where you're wanting to put an axe through your tv!Season Two: One step higher in suspense involving getting rid of an atomic bomb, and Jack sacrificing his life for his country.  This really shows how Jack puts family and his country first before himself.Season Three: Holy crap, this one killed me!  An airborne virus is released into Los Angeles, killing hundreds of people, while the romance of Michelle and Tony is a major entertaining part of the season.  This is one of the top seasons of the entire show!Season Four: Sad to say, but this one didn't quite pull me as the other ones have.  Though the bad guy is clever, they never really catch him, and it seems that some of the same things are repeated.  But the season finale is amazingly done, and people have said, that the show could've ended here.  This is somewhat true, but we would've said goodbye to classic characters so soon.Season Five: MY FAVORITE SEASON EVER!  This is a major comeback from the previous season, as Jack is forced to come out of hiding.  This season just never stops giving screams and thrills no other, and Sutherland really did deserve the golden globe that year.  This definitely is the season to watch if you're ever bored.Season Six: Lots of people didn't like this one, but I really did enjoy it a lot!  Again, it shows the deeper level of Jack's humanity and his desire for a normal life.  I loved how some lovable characters came back, and it gets you ready for the upcoming seventh season.  But lets hope that the show keeps our hopes alive, and stays immortal on FOX TV.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I must say that I am a BIG FAN of 24 not watching since it first aired but when I bought all 6 seasons on DVD! The whole series is exsplosive with constant action and great drama. Jack Bauer IS my favorite charater on the show. The death of David Paulmer was indeed the only sad thing.Can't wait for 24 season 7 to start airing on FOX 39 in January 2009. Now I am really into the show!! The DVD for SEASON 7 will possibly be coming out in December 2009?? I HOPE Many people say that the end of Season 6 Day 6 left a big gap not knowing what will happen next. WELL FOLKS! Fox 39 tv network has the solution. A 2 hour TV movie will be presented on NOVEMBER 23rd 2008 to recap what happend last in season 6 and what will happen in Season 7. The movie will be titled 24:The Exile.This movie is due to the January 2008 writers strike forcing Fox and the cast of 24 to postpone SEASON 7.

reviewText: What can I say?  24 is the REAL THING.  By this I mean that it is super entertaining and brilliantly casted and written.  To anyone who loves heart stopping action and "on-the-edge-of-your-seat" TV drama, this is the one to watch.  Keifer has that special something that many TV actors lack and the rest of the cast is also very good.  Buy this if you can; you will not be sorry.
Title: N/A

reviewText: About 3 years ago, I bought the first season of 24, and since then, I've been hooked on this show! It's awesome and has great characters, great actors, a great storyline, suspense, action, and politics! In the very beginning, C.T.U. agent Jack Bauer has to save David Palmer, an African-American who runs for President. He also has to save his wife and daughter. Since then, Jack has stop terrorist attacks, nuclear bombs, a deadly virus, nerve gas, kill people to save thousands, break criminals out of jail, survive a plane crash, get over a drug problem, deal with the loss of his wife and friends, held in a Chinese prison for 2 years and much more. Jack Bauer is the ultimate tragic hero. I highly recommed 24: SEASONS 1-6!!!

reviewText: I bought this for my husband because he became a big fan of 24 late in its production.  He absolutely loves the set and is in the process of watching it from the beginning.  He said it made some things make more sense to him that are in the show today.  I definitely recommend this set to anyone looking for a gift for someone or if you yourself like 24 and want to understand the show better.

reviewText: This is an incredibly tense show, always on the edge, even if it gets a little cheesy at times you have to keep in mind they are doing a LOT in a LITTLE to give us as much as they can without killing everyone on the entire show at the same time, which might be a new interesting twist.BUT I don't get it Amazon...You can buy each individual season for 19.99 or cheaper on the rest of your site, then you throw six seasons together so you can charge us 80 extra bucks????? At least throw in 24: Redemption for free, along with bonus discs, digital copies, something.For 80 extra dollars I would expect to get 24:Redemption and even season 7 pre-order for Free.
